La señora Irma Rosa, desarrolla su actividad de cría de cerdos para la venta al por menor en Costa Rica, en la provincia de Puntarenas, Palmar Norte, Jalaca, zona del país con uno de los indices de desarrollo humano mas bajo según la ultima estadistica contenida en el Estado de la Nación 2011, esta situación hace que las mujeres antes la dificultad para conseguir un trabajo remunerado tenga la necesidad de autoemplearse, en el caso de Irma ella ya habia participado en el primer ciclo de préstamo de un Banco Mujer, al trasladarse a Jalaca, continua con esta actividad, pero la misma presenta el inconveniente que dado las limitaciones de capital, no ha podido construir una paridera, que es un espacio dentro del chiquero, donde se ponen los cerdos recien nacidos, una vez que son alimentados por la cerda madre, porque en el espacio donde esta la cerda no pueden estar todo el dia las crias porque se corre el riesgo que los cerditos mueran aplastados por su propia madre, como ya ha sucedido, de alli la urgente necesidad de hacer esta construcción, así como contar con el concentrado de crecimiento ya que en este momento tiene dieciseis cerditos que demandan este alimento, para poder lograr un crecimiento adecuado, asi mismo se deben de vacunas para protegerles de enfermedades.
La meta que se ha propuesto Irma Rosa, es poder contar con tres cerdas, para de esta forma estar sacando a la venta unos treinta cerditos cada seis meses, lo que le permitira pagar la mensualidad del préstamo, capitalizar, y poder ayudar con el sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Irma Rosa developed her business of raising pigs for retail sale in Costa Rica, in the province of Puntarenas, Palmar Norte, Jalaca, a zone with one of the lowest indices of human development in the country, according to the latest statistics contained in the State of the Nation 2011. This situation means that in the face of the difficulty of finding a paying job, the women need to become their own employers. In the case of Irma, she had already participated in her first loan cycle at a Banco Mujer. Upon moving to Jalaca, she continued with this business, but it presented the drawback that, given the limitations of her capital, she was not able to construct a farrowing pen, which is a space inside the pigsty where they put the recently born little pigs once they are being fed by the mother pig, because the little pigs can't be in the space with the mother pig all day because they run the risk of being crushed by their own mother, as has already happened. Thus there is an urgent need to do this construction, as well as to have growth feed concentrate, since at this time she has sixteen little pigs that need this food to be able to achieve adequate growth. At the same time, they need vaccines to protect them from diseases.

The goal that Irma Rosa has set for herself is to be able to have three sows, so that in this way she can be taking some thirty little pigs to sell every six months, which will permit her to make the monthly loan payments, capitalize her business, and be able to help support her household.

loans.use: to construct a farrowing pen and buy pigs, feed concentrate, and vaccines.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es socio del Banco Comunal El Trebol, tiene 52 años y tiene 7 hijos que viven con él. Francisco tiene más de un año en FINCA Perú y se dedica a la crianza de cuyes (guinea pigs). Francisco también trabaja en una empresa de helados. Gracias a FINCA Perú, Francisco creció su criadero de cuyes, también aprendió a ahorrar y a administrar mejor su dinero. A él le gustan las reuniones de su banco comunal por las charlas que le ayudan a educar a sus hijos. Francisco invertirá su nuevo préstamo para la compra de más cuyes madres.
texts.en:
Francisco is a member of the Communal Bank "El Trebol" (The Clover). He is 52 years old and has seven children who live with him. Francisco has been with FINCA Peru for more than a year. He raises guinea pigs, but he also works for an ice cream company.

Thanks to FINCA Peru, Francisco was able to grow his guinea pig business. He also learned how to save and better manage his money. He enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because of the seminars that have helped to educate his children. Francisco will invest his new loan in the purchase of more female guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos Humberto, tiene 31 años de edad, desde hace 4 años vive con su esposa en la aldea Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Carlos ha sido agricultor desde muy pequeño, trabajando con su padre adquirió mucha experiencia de varios cultivos, principalmente en el cultivo de Yuca. Su padre le heredó un área de terreno donde se ha independizado con su propio cultivo. Trabaja desde las 6:00  de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la tarde todos los días. El cultiva yuca de calidad y la vende al por mayor en el mercado de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
El préstamo que solicita es de 3,000.00 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes o abonos y pago de limpieza de la plantilla de yuca.  Dándole un buen  mantenimiento  va poder sacar una buena cosecha. Con las ganancias va incrementar sus cultivos para ofrecer más producto al mercado.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto is 31 years old. For the past four years, he has lived with his wife in the neighborhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Carlos has been farming from a very young age. Working with his father allowed him to gain much experience around various crops, primarily the cultivation of cassava. His father inherited a plot of land, thus enabling him to be independent and grow his own crop. Carlos works from 6am to 3pm every day. He grows good-quality cassava and sells it in bulk at the market in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Carlos is requesting a loan of 3,000 HNL in order to buy fertilizers and compost, as well as pay for the clearing of his cassava fields. By providing good maintenance, he will be able to achieve a good harvest. With his earnings, Carlos will be able to increase his crops and offer more products at the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and composts and to pay for the clearing of his fields.

location.town: El Olvido Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is a 28-year-old married mom in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She wants the best for her two children. She solely raises her kids by means of a home products sales business which started four years ago and from which she gets 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.

Through the help of a GDMPC loan of 20,000 PHP, she's able to purchase additional products to sell. Someday, she dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 44-year-old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. With the help of her husband, Elsa has been gardening for about three years now and this has become their main source of income. They usually earn 5,000 PHP monthly. She and her husband have to persevere even in old age in order to provide a good education for their seven children. This year she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro finance to purchase fertilizer. She hopes to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Novie

texts.en: Novie of Mailen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental supports the needs of her two children through home products and food vending. She’s a 41-year-old mother and wife of a safety martial who tries her best to earn on her own. She gets 2,500 PHP a month. This year, she’s in need of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell for her business. Thanks to GDMPC microfinance for proving such needs. She desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married. Jane works very hard to provide for her family.

Jane runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Jane has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, toys and school supplies. 

In the future, Jane would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Doña Zaida ha sido cliente de Fundación Mujer durante varios años , en los que ha adquirido prestamos con el fin de tener flujo para su capital de trabajo.
Ella confecciona colchas cortinas, almohadones que sus clientes compran para decorar sus hogares. Además doña Zaida vende algunos otros productos de catalogo, pues como ella misma dice todo lo que ella vende se lo compran, pues tiene una forma muy agradable de atender a sus clientes.
 Doña Zaida vive solamente con su esposo , con el que tiene 40 años de vivir, todos sus hijos son adultos, sin embargo doña Zaida siempre ha contribuido con la economía familiar desde que sus hijos eran pequeños, ahora ayuda a una de sus hijas a terminar su carrera universitaria y tambien colabora con el cuido de su nieta.
texts.en:
Zaida has been a client of Fundación Mujer for several years, during which time she has gotten loans with the goal of having a flow of working capital.  She makes bedspreads, curtains, and cushions that her customers buy to decorate their homes.  Zaida also sells some other catalogue products.  She herself always says that what she sells, they buy from her, because she has a very pleasant way of serving her customers.

Zaida lives only with her husband, with whom she has lived for 40 years.  All her children are adults.  Nevertheless, Zaida always has contributed to the family finances since her children were little.  Now she is helping one of her daughters finish her university studies, and also helps take care of her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, and foam to make bedspreads, curtains, tablecloths, and other items for home decorating.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy es socio del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, tiene 30 años, es casado y padre de 2 niños. Freddy se dedica a la venta de maquinarias y es socio hace 3 años. Se siente muy tranquilo por las cosas que ha realizado, las capacitaciones de FINCA Perú le ayudaron a crecer su negocio y a tener una buena relación familiar. Freddy se siente satisfecho en cada reunión de desembolso porque ve como se incrementan sus ahorros. Freddy invertirá su nuevo préstamo en el pago de las maquinarias que adquirió.
texts.en:
Freddy is a member of the Communal Bank "Yanapanakusun". He is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. Freddy sells machinery and has been a member for three years. He feels at peace with what he has accomplished. The training from FINCA Peru helped him to grow his business and have a good relationship with his family. Freddy is very pleased at each disbursement meeting because he knows he will be able to increase his savings.

He will invest his new loan in the payment of machinery that he will acquire.

loans.use: to buy machinery to sell.

loans.name: Jesel

texts.en: Jesel is a 33 years old mother of one child. They live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has to be a mother and a father at the same time. She’s good at dealing with people. That is why she entered into a buy and sell kind of business to earn an income for the family. She normally gets 2,000 PHP a month.  At present, she has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional products to sell. Her plans involve business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza desarrolla su actividad productiva de fabricación de prendas de vestir, pantalonetas,buzos, bolsos; en Costa Rica, en la provincia de Puntarenas, en el cantón de Corredores, Paso Canoas, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace quince años, ella es una ex integrante de un Banco Mujer, que tomo la decisión de comenzar en forma independiente la misma actividad que desarrollo durante la permanencia en el grupo de mujeres; esto le ha permitido capitalizar utilidades lo que se puede observar en las maquinaria que ella posee, lo que le permite la fabricación de diversas prendas de vestir ajustandolas a la epoca, sin embargo la dificultad que tiene que afrontar es que en el lugar donde ella vive no hay distribuidores de las materias primas y otros materiales necesarios para la confección, lo que hace necesario que ella se desplaze hasta 250 kilometros para poder adquirirlas y a un precio muy alto, con este préstamo piensa desplazarse a la capiatl del país San José, para poder adquirir sus materiales, los cuales ella ya cotizo y se los venden a la mitad de precio de lo que ella los consigue alla en la zona, de allí la importancia que para ella tiene el poder contar con este crédito, ya que mercado para los productos que elabora existe, por cuanto ella ofrece productos de calidad a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Maritza works making articles of clothing, shorts, track suits, and bags in Costa Rica, in the province of Puntarenas, in the canton of Corredores, Paso Canoas.  She has been doing this work for 15 years.  She is a former member of Banco Mujer who made the decision to start working independently in the same activity she did during her time with the group of women.  This has allowed her to reinvest her profits.  This can be seen in the machinery she has, which allows her to make various articles of clothing, adapting them to the season. 

Nevertheless, the difficulty she has to face is that, where she lives, there are no distributors of the materials necessary for her clothing.  This makes it necessary for her to travel up to 250 kilometers to be able to get them, and at a very high price.

With this loan she plans to go to the capital of the country, San José, to be able to acquire her materials, for which she already got an estimate and they sell her at half the price at which she gets them in her region.  This is why it is important for her to get this loan, because there is a market for the products she makes, insofar as she offers quality products at a good price.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Martin Adan

texts.es:
Martin es un joven que vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica peru;  convive junto a su pareja y juntos tienen  pequeños hijos cuyas edades comprenden 1 y 4 añitos, su pareja lo apoya en todo lo que el hace, asimismo ella trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza para aportar con los gastos del hogar, como buen peruano a Martin le gusta mucho jugar futbol en sus tiempos libres y como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”, el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar enfermería.

Martin trabaja como chofer, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes al día, así como también apoya a su esposa en la venta de sus productos de belleza ya que la lleva a visitar a sus clientes y a entregar los pedidos que ella tiene, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y porque es atento y respetuoso con los clientes.

Martin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo así como también apoyar a su esposa en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, lo que les permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y tener un vehículo más seguro para el transporte de los clientes, así seguirán trabajando y podrán seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño: “Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y Tener su moto propia”.
texts.en:
Martin is a young man from the district of Parcon in Ica, Peru.  He lives with his partner, with whom he has young children who are one and four years old.  His partner supports him in everything he does and she also sells beauty products to help with the household expenses.  Like all good Peruvians, Martin loves to play soccer in his free time.  Also like a good Peruvian, he loves food and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious arroz con pato.  He studied up until the fifth grade, but he really would have liked to have studied nursing.

Martin works as a chauffeur, spending around nine hours a day working.  He can serve up to 45 customers per day.  He also helps his partner sell her beauty products, as he drives her to see her customers and to deliver her orders.  He believes that his business is going well because he is very hardworking and because he is attentive and respectful with his customers.

Martin is very thankful to Kiva's lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to perform maintenance on his car and he will also be able to help his partner buy merchandise for her business.  This will allow them to increase their earnings and to have a safer car to transport their customers, which will allow them to keep working and striving to achieve their greatest dream: to give their children a good education and to have their own motorcycle.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car and to buy merchandise (beauty products)

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her variety store. The home products retail business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Matilde and her family with increased income and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a 31-year old resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She provides her child's needs from the little amount of 6,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own sari-sari store as an aid to the income gained from her husband who is a private employee. This year, she applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC microfinance to buy additional stocks to sell. She wants to improve her business one day.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente, la casa en la que viven es propia y esta ubicada en un caserío de nombre Tongorrape perteneciente al Distrito de Motúpe y el Mismo a la Provincia de Lambayeque.

Candelaria se dedica a la venta de animales menores como aves de corral entre otros, se dedica todos los días de la semana al cuidado de los mismos pues se preocupa por darles un trato especial para su engorde y crecimiento rápido para poder ser promocionados y ofrecidos en los caseríos o mercados cercanos a su casa. Ha dicha actividad se dedica ya un aproximado de 10 años, lo que le permitido generarse sus ingresos para sus gastos diarios.

Candelaria desea comprar animales entre ovinos y caprinos con los que pueda aumentar su capital de trabajo y así hacer mas grande su negocio debido que considera que aun tiene mercado por satisfacer para generarse mayores utilidades con los que mejorará sus condiciones de vida, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1200 Nuevos Soles los invertirá en lo antes mencionado.

Es muy conocida en la zona donde vive, por el tipo de negocio y es muy solicitada por la buena atención que brinda.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a mother of a family and is 60 years old.  She has 2 children who are grown and economically independent.  The house that they live in is her own and is located in a farmhouse called "Tongorrape" which belongs to the Motúpe District and to the same province of Lambayeque.

Candelaria sells young animals like fowl among others.  She works every day taking care of the animals.  She focuses on giving them special treatment so as to fatten them up and grow quickly in order to be able to be sold and offered in the farmhouses or markets near her home.  She has been working at this job for approximately 10 years, which has allowed her to generate the income needed for her daily expenses.

Candelaria wants to buy animals such as sheep and goats, with which she will be able to increase her working capital and therefore make her business larger.  She thinks that she still has the market for satisfying for making greater profits with them that will improve her life conditions.  This is why she is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1200 nuevos soles.  She will invest the money in the previously mentioned things.

She is very well-known in the area where she lives for the type of business that she has, and she is very popular because of the good attention that she provides.

loans.use: buy livestock (sheet and goats)

loans.name: Rosa Milagros

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora es madre de 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 16 y 1 añito, a los cuales ama mucho y su motor para seguir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos que se puedan presentar, rosa vive en la ciudad de nazca , ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y por la generosidad de sus pobladores, así como también por su actividad principal que es la agricultura; en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a conversar con sus amigos, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo escabeche, rosa solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Secretariado.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes en el cual trabaja actualmente, puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicada y sobre todo que hace su trabajo con muchas ganas.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y asi seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” construir su Casa y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hardworking woman.  She is the mother of two children who are 16 and 1 year old, whom she loves very much and who are her motivation to get ahead despite the obstacles that may get in her way.  Rosa lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for its hot climate, the generosity of its people, and its main industry, which is agriculture.  In her free time she likes to chat with her friends.  Like a good Peruvian, she loves typical Peruvian food, and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious escabeche.  Rosa only studied up until the fifth grade, but she would have liked to have trained to be a secretary.

After much effort, she was able to start her business selling groceries.  She currently works in this business, serving up to 20 customers per day.  She believes that her business is going well because she is very dedicated and above all because she puts a lot of effort into her work.

Rosa is very thankful to Kiva's lenders as it is because of their help that she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  This will allow her to have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers and thus keep working toward achieving her greatest dream: to build a home and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath, 30, is married. She resides with her husband and three school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over five years, earning approximately USD $4 per day. Additionally, she runs the business of buying chickens to resell at the market to generate extra income for the family, approximately $13 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Rath is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting as well as carrying chickens to sell at the market. This purchase would enable her to carry more chickens to sell and generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the extra profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting as well as carrying chickens to sell.

loans.name: Bombonas Group

texts.es:
El grupo bombonas está compuesto por 6 mujeres emprendedoras, decidieron llamarse así porque todas en común tienen una personalidad dulce como el bombón. El grupo celebra sus reuniones cada semana al sureste de la ciudad de Monterrey.
Alexi es una de las integrantes del grupo, está casada y tiene tres hijos (9,7 y 2 años) de los cuáles dos son estudiantes de primaria y se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, realizando las fórmulas entre ella y su pareja. Comenzó con este negocio cuando su esposo se quedó sin trabajo pasando por una crisis económica, donde ella quería ayudar. Su cónyuge entro a trabajar en una empresa de productos de limpieza y le consegue a Alexi los químicos a un menor costo; ella vio la oportunidad y empezó a venderlos entre sus vecinas y así sacar un poco mas de ganancias para sustentar a su familia.
Ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio, vender más y así salir adelante para construir una casa más grande, poner una tienda y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The group "Bombonas" (Bonbons) consists of six enterprising women. They chose this name for themselves because they all have in common personalities that are as sweet as a bonbon. The group conducts their meetings every week in the southeast section of the city of Monterrey.

Alexi is one of the members of the group. She is married and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 2), two of whom are elementary school students. Alexi sells cleaning products made from formulas that she and her partner created. She started this business because she wanted to help her husband when he became unemployed as a result of the financial crisis. Her husband has started working for a cleaning products company, so Alexi is able to to acquire chemicals at low cost. Once she saw this opportunity, Alexi began selling to her neighbors and has slowly earned more income to sustain her family. She wants to grow her business, sell more, and move forward with building a larger house so that she can set up a store and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Armie Group

texts.en:
Armie is married with four children. Armie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Armie is a farmer and grows rice and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase more fertilizer for her rice and banana production. 

Armie has been a member of PMPC for four years.

Armie is the leader of a four-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer for her rice and banana production

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 59 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with five children. Four of the children are adults and one is school age. 

Emelia has a tractor and tracer business and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP for the payment of tuition fees for her children.

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been running a sewing shop for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a harvester who harvests rice to generate income for the family. 

He earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve her business, Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase cloth for sewing more clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her sewing shop and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for sewing more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosie Group

texts.en:
Rosie is 44 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with six children. Rosie works in the fish industry. She sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase pump boat accessories. 

Rosie has been a member of PMPC for six years. Rosie is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase pump boat accessories

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Pheang, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over three years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is employed in the Cambodian Art Institution and earns approximately $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Pheang is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store in the market for selling fruit, and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Seab, 44, is widowed and resides with five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, she earns $5 per day. 

Three of her children are employed in a garment factory and earn about $10 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Seab is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase fertilizer and fuel for using in her farming work. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to grow agricultural crops, and help her children get bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel for using in her farming work.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Edisa obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to broaden her assortment of goods and raise her floating capital. Today, Edisa earns about 25,000 Kyrgyzstan Soms (KGS) in a month, which allows her to make a small purchase of goods for reselling and cover her family expenses. 

Now Edisa has applied for a loan of KGS 100,000 for broadening her business by purchasing children's clothes for the coming season. Revenues from this loan will be partly used for renovation of her family’s flat.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.name: Saraem

texts.en: Saraem, 24, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over four years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns about USD 7 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, she wants to run an additional business. With this goal in mind, Saraem is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a piece of farmland for growing agricultural crops in order to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house and help her child get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over five years; they have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and breeding pigs to sell. They earn approximately $10 per day. Additionally, her husband is a chief village leader. Three of her children are employed; two are garment workers and another one is a construction worker. Approximately, they earn $11 per day. 

Due to difficulty with the family’s transportation, Morn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Puthrea

texts.en: Puthrea, 27, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over seven years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening cattle. They earn approximately USD 5 per day. In order to develop her family’s economy, Puthrea would like to run an additional business. With this additional business in mind, Puthrea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a public transportation service to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and help her child get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Nahada

texts.en:
Nahada is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Nahada has a shop where she sells home products like flashlights, clocks & plates. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stocks like flashlights, plates & clocks to sell.

Nahada has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Nahada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like flashlights, plates & clocks to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Perla has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy snacks, canned goods and vegetables to sell.

Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Editha has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Marilyn has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Genelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Genelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gerlie has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gerlie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gerlie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Nejane

texts.en:
Nejane is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Nejane has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

Nejane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nejane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has been in the charcoal sale business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is 38 years old and single.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during awareness efforts, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of charcoal to sell in her business.

In the future, Milkah hopes to expand her business and supply charcoal to other parts of Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gisela Judith

texts.es:
Gisela es una mujer muy luchadora la cual es madre de 2 hijas cuyas edades comprenden 3 y 14 años, ella los quiere y ama muchísimo esta muy orgullosa de ellos y nos comenta que son el regalos mas bonito que Dios le ha dado, su pareja también es un hombre muy trabajador, el trabaja como soldador en un taller y así apoya con los gastos del hogar, uno de los pasatiempos de Gisela es la preparación de postres así como también cocinar por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”, ella estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería, por ello trabaja muy duro porque ella desea que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y tengan una profesión.

Gisela trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 15 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende bien a los clientes.

Gisela esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería y tener mas variedad e productos para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Gisela is a very feisty woman and mother to two daughters aged 3 and 14. She loves them so much is very proud of them, tells us that they are the most beautiful gifts God has given her. Her partner is also a hardworking man. He works as a welder in a workshop and supports the household expenses.

One of Gisela's pastimes is the preparation of desserts and cooking, and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious duck rice 'arroz con pato'.
 
Gisela studied until the fifth grade, but she would have liked to study nursing. She is therefore working hard because she wants her children to do better than her and have a career.

Gisela has a business selling groceries, soft drinks and beers. She works around 15 hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers in one day. She believes that her business is doing well because she provides good service to her customers.

Gisela is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to your help she can buy more merchandise and offer a wider variety of products to offer her customers. This allows her to continue working to fulfill her dream of 'giving her daughters a good career'.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, 63, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, her business partner. She is the mother of her children .She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children from five to seven years old. He describes himself to be diligent. He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for eight years and employs two staff members. His business is located in an area conducive to the business and his primary customers are companies and motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more spare parts to sell. Simon's business goal is to prosper in his business and run a well-stocked retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Nelly Rosario

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer muy emprendedora y humilde, vive en la ciudad de camama, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima calido, sus hermosas playas y por ser una de las ciudades con una producción alta en el cultivo de arroz y por la generosidad de sus pobladores; junto a su esposo tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 10 y 7 años, su esposo trabaja como obrero así como también como agricultor, en sus tiempos libres Nelly disfruta de ver películas, en especial si son comedias ya que la ayudan a relajarse y olvidarse de las preocupaciones del día a día, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida por ello uno de los paltos favoritos de Nelly es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”.

Nelly trabaja en su negocio de venta de calzado, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes de manera diaria, es muy carismática y sobre todo atenta con los clientes por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio así como también porque se esfuerza por salir adelante cada día para que sus hijos tengan una buena cálida de vida ya que son su razón de vivir.

Nelly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería en especial zapatos para temporada escolar, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y así aumentar sus ingresos, con ello seguirá luchando y esforzándose para crecer cada día y poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Ver a sus hijos hechos unos profesionales”.
texts.en:
Nelly is a very enterprising and humble woman.  She lives in the city of Camama, which is known for its hot climate, for its beautiful beaches, for being one of the cities with the highest production of rice, and for the generosity of its people.  She has two children with her husband who are 10 and 7 years old.  Her husband works as a laborer and also as a farmer.  In her free time, Nelly likes to watch movies, especially comedies because they help her relax and forget about her everyday worries.  Like all good Peruvians, she loves Peruvian food, and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious chupe de camarones.

Nelly works at her business selling shoes.  She spends about 10 hours a day at her business and she can serve up to 15 customers daily.  She is very charismatic and above all attentive with her customers, which is why she thinks her business is going well.  She also puts a lot of effort into getting ahead every day so that her children can have a good quality of life, as they are her reason for living.

Nelly is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is because of their help that she will be able to buy more merchandise, especially shoes for the school year.  This will allow her to have a wider variety of products and thus increase her earnings.  She will keep struggling and applying herself to grow every day and be able to achieve her greatest dream: to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Grabiel Augusto

texts.es:
Grabiel vive en la ciudad de nazca, tiene 47 años de edad pero el nos comenta que tiene el espíritu y la alegría de un joven de 20, es padre de 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 18 y 15 años, a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su orgullo; como buen peruano le gusta la comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo Estofado, a Grabiel le gusta mucho leer en su tiempos libres lo ayuda a distraerse de las preocupaciones del día a día, el estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contabilidad.

Grabiel trabaja en su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al dia, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta la limpieza y atender de manera amable a los clientes.

Grabiel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar más carne, lo que le permitirá tener más producto para ofrecer y poder atender los pedidos de sus clientes, asi seguirá trabajando y luchando cada dia para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean uno profesionales”.
texts.en:
Grabiel lives in the city of Nazca. He is 47 years old but he says that he has the spirit and joy of a 20 year old. He is the father of 2 children aged 18 and 15, whom he loves very much - they are his pride. 

As a good Peruvian he likes his food and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious stew 'Estofado'. Grabiel loves to read in his spare time as it helps to distract him from his day-to-day cares. He studied until the fifth grade of secondary education, but he would have liked to study accounting.

Grabiel has his own business selling pork. He works about 8 hours a day and serves up to 15 clients daily. He believes that his business is doing well because he likes to keep his premises clean and he looks after his customers in a friendly manner.

Grabiel is very grateful to Kiva lenders and, thanks to your support he can buy more meat, allowing him to have more products to offer and to meet orders from customers. He can continue working and struggling every day to fulfill his dream to 'have his own home and for his children to become professionals'.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (pig meat)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been in the rental housing business in Nakuru town for the last nine years. She is 43 years old, married to Ngugi and together they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more building materials and facilities to help her in the construction of her rental houses.

In the future, Martha hopes to own a residential estate in the area and become one of the leading property entrepreneurs in the region, making more income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 22 años de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y la generosidad de sus pobladores, el es muy trabajador y sobre todo siempre tienen una sonrisa para ofrecer a los demás, el en sus tiempos libres disfruta mucho de escuchar música y como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida por ello uno de los platillos que más le gusta son las riquísimas” lentejitas”, julios estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería.

Julio trabaja como chofer, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 6 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día, en algunos días trabaja como obrero en las minas que hay en su ciudad y lo hace porque un dinerito extra siempre cae bien sobre todo si en honrado nos comenta julio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y respetuoso.

Julio esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para poder cumplir más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Julio is a young man of 22 who lives in the city of Nazca, a city characterized by its warm climate and generous people. He is hard working and above all always has a smile to offer others. In his free time, Julio enjoys listening to music and as a good Peruvian he likes his food. One of his favorite dishes is the delicious lentil dish "lentejitas". Julio studied until the fifth grade of secondary education, but would have liked study engineering.

Julio works as a chauffeur. He works around six hours a day, serving up to 20 clients per day. On some days he works as a laborer in the mines in his city, and he does this to make some extra money. He always does well because he is honest, above all else. Julio says that he believes his business is doing because he is very friendly and respectful to his customers.

July is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help they have given he can make improvements to his home and achieve a better quality of life. This allows him to keep fighting every day to fulfill his bigger dreams, "to finish building his house. "

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria es una joven muy entusiasta, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Ica, Perú, el cual se caracteriza por su actividad principal que es la agricultura, ella es muy luchadora tal es así que con mucho esfuerzo logro terminar su carrera de Obstetricia pero le hubiera gustado estudiar medicina humana; como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida por ello uno de los platillos que más le gusta es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”.

Flor de Maria gracias a su esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas en su negocio y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ella tiene muy buena sazón y sus comida le salen riquísimo por ello los clientes siempre regresan.

Flor de Maria esta agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar vitrinas y una exhibidora con lo cual mejorara su negocio ya que tendrá un lugar mas higiénico donde exhibir sus platillos y los clientes sentirán mucho mas confianza en consumirlos, así seguirá trabajando y luchando cada día para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener varios Restaurantes”.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is a very enthusiastic young lady who lives in the Tinguiña district in Ica, Peru, which is characterized by agriculture which is the main industry. She is a fighter, and so with much hard work she was able to finish her studies in Obstetrics, but she would have liked to study human medicine. As a good Peruvian she loves food and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious duck rice, "Arroz con Pato".

Flor de Maria, thanks to her effort and her savings, was able to start a business selling food. She works around 8 hours each day and can serve up to 30 clients daily. She believes that her business is doing well because her dishes are very flavorsome and she makes delicious food and this is why her customers keep coming back.

Flor de Maria is grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to the help they have given she can buy a display unit for her food and thereby improve her business. She will have a more hygienic place to display her dishes and customers will feel much more confident in consuming them, and she will continue working and struggling every day to fulfill her dream, "to have several restaurants."

loans.use: to purchase display cases to exhibit her dishes

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho, tiene 46 años y es madre de 5 hijos. Teodora es  socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, tiene una chacra donde siembra cereales y vende y compra ganado. Ella está agradecida a FINCA Perú por las capacitaciones recibidas que la ayudaron a fortalecer su negocio y lograr que continúe creciendo. Con su nuevo préstamo, Teodora invertirá en la compra de semilla y abono.
texts.en: Teodora is a member of Communal Bank of San Miguel de Ayacucho. She is 46 years old and mother to 5 children. Teodora has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She has a farm where she grows grains, and she buys and sells cattle. She is grateful to FINCA Peru for the training she has received that helped strengthen her business and enable her to continue growing it. With her new loan, Teodora will purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 40 year-old married man. He has four children between the ages of two and 15 years. He describes himself as competent and ambitious. He operates a retail business providing motor vehicle repairs and selling spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area conducive to his service; his primary customers are mechanics. His biggest business challenge is the high price of spare parts. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more spare parts. Joseph's business dream and goal is to run two more spare parts retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to improve vehicle repair services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has been in the carrot selling business in Nakuru for the last seven years.  She is 42 years-old and single.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness campaign; this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of carrots to sell.

In the future, Alice hopes to expand her business and supply carrots to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carrots to sell in her business.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years. She is 41 years-old and single.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers; this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to purchase fertilizers and potato seedlings for her farm.  In the future, Philis hopes to become one of the leading farmers in her area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah (pictured in the middle) is a married man. He has a one year-old daughter. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a motorcycle business providing transportation. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a competitive market and his primary customers are passengers. He also increases his income from his wife's grocery store. His biggest business challenge is the high price of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetable and fruits for his wife. Elijahs's business goal is to be financially stable within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for his wife.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven muy entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, su clima cálido, así como también por ser la cuna de las glorias del deporte peruano y por la sazón de sus pobladores para la cocina, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”, el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar medicina. El convive con su pareja y siempre lo apoya en todo, el nos comenta que es su mano derecha; juntos tienen 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 3 y 6 añitos, los ama mucho y son su razón de vivir.

Miguel trabaja como lustrador de zapatos, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo que trabaja con mucho esmero.

Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar materiales e insumos para que su esposa puede iniciar su negocio de venta de desayuno y así poder tener un ingreso mas para el hogar, con ello podrán mejorar su cálida de vida y seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y una profesión para que sean mejores que él”.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very enthusiastic youth. He lives in the city of Chincha, a city characterized by its beautiful beaches, warm climate and also for being the cradle of glory of Peruvian sports and for the cooking skills of its inhabitants. One of his favorite dishes is the delicious “Rice with duck”. Miguel studied until the 5th grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to have studied medicine. He lives with his partner and she always supports him in everything. He tells us that she is his right hand; together they have 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. He loves them a lot and they are his reason for living.

Miguel works as a shoe shiner. He dedicates about 10 hours a day to his work and can serve up to 40 customers a day. He believes that his business is going well because he is always really friendly with the customers and above all because he works very carefully.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy materials and supplies so that his wife can start her breakfast-selling business. In that way, they will have one more source of income for the household with which they will be able to improve their quality of life and continue working to accomplish their big dream “To give a good quality of life to their children as well as a profession so that they are better than him.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a breakfast-selling business.

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica , Perú; este distrito se caracteriza por tener como una de sus actividades principales la agricultura así como también uno de sus atractivos turísticos que es el “Bosque de piedras”, Juan vive con su pareja y juntos tienen un pequeño de 3 años de edad, el cual cursa educación inicial, su pareja lo apoya en todo es su mano derecha y siempre le da ánimos para seguir adelante sobre todo por su hijito que es su razón de vivir de ambos; como buen peruano a Juan le gusta mucho la comida, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”, el estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Juan trabaja en su negocio de transporte de agua en un tanque, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, es muy agotador sobre todo porque va a lugares poco accesibles donde no hay agua potable. el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo amable con las personas ademas tiene paciencia con los clientes.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá reparar y realizar un mantenimiento a su camión, así tendrá un vehículo más seguro y podrá seguir trabajando para seguir luchando día a día para salir adelante y cumplir su más grande sueño:”
texts.en:
Juan lives in Parcona district, Ica, Peru.  One of the main business activities in this district is farming and the area is well known for one of its tourist attractions, the 'Bosque de piedras' (Rock Forest) [large, scenic rock formations].  Juan lives with his partner and the couple have a 3-year-old son who is in pre-school.  Juan's partner supports him in everything.  She is his right-hand woman and always encourages him to do well, especially for their young son who is their reason for living.  Like all good Peruvians, Juan really enjoys his food.  One of his favorite dishes is the delicious 'arroz con pato' (rice and duck).  Juan studied up to the fifth year of his secondary education but he would have liked to have gone on to study nursing.

Juan works in his own business transporting water in a tank.  He works in his business for around 10 hours a day.  It is exhausting, above all because he travels to relatively inaccessible areas where there is no drinking water.  He believes that his business is doing well because he is responsible and, above all, he is kind to people.  He also has patience with his customers.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to your help, he will be able to repair his truck and have some maintenance work carried out on it.  This will give him a safer vehicle and he will be able to continue working hard every day to make progress and fulfill his biggest dream.

loans.use: to have maintenance work and repair work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, etá integrado por 14 mujeres, todas son trabajadoras muy unidas  nunca tuvieron problemas, pero siempre supieron sobrellevar todo con la unidad que tienen ellas por el cual son reconocidas en el barrio.
Viviana es modista, y nos cuenta que se dedica a esto hace ya varios años, lo cual le ha ayudado a formarse una buena clientela. Trabaja todos los días y dice que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y trabajo de sus clientes. Su objetivo es seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y cumplir con pedidos que le hicieron sus clientes. El grupo agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) committee is located in the city of San Lorenzo.  It is made up of 14 hard-working women who are very united.  They have never experienced any problems.  They have been able to overcome everything thanks to their unity which is something they are known for in their neighborhood.

Viviana is a dressmaker and she tells us that she has been in this business for several years now.  This has helped her to establish a good customer base.  She works every day and says that she always has a lot of orders and work from her customers.  Her aim is to continue working and helping her family.

Viviana is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread so that she can stock her business and fill the orders that her customers make with her.  The group is grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Tembiapo Porá Group

texts.es:
Tembiapo Pora se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que una de las miembros  contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 13 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 10° ciclo, en forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de respeto.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y comenta que se dedica a esto hace ya un tiempo, gracias a su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Su meta es seguir creciendo como comerciante y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y tener en stock para los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tembiapo Pora is the name of this fine group of women which was formed in the city of Ita when one of its members contacted a loan officer during a weekly meeting that she had in the area in order to find out more about the way in which the 'Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program' works.  Once she had been given information about the program, she managed to gather together 13 women who are now working very happily together on their 10th loan cycle, in an atmosphere of mutual respect.

Blanca's business is selling drinks and she says that she has been in this business for some time.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family and provide them with everything they need to lead a decent life without hardships.  Her goal is to continue growing as a saleswoman and thereby continue helping her family.  Blanca is requesting this loan to buy drinks with which to stock her business so that she has merchandise in stock to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Richie Group

texts.en: Richie is 30 years old and lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with 1 child. Richie has a shop that sells grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 10 boxes of grocery items and soft drinks. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Richie is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of grocery items and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tito Alberto

texts.es:
Tito tiene 56 años de edad es casado, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo mayor de edad, en un distrito  pequeño el cual esta dedicado netamente al comercio de ganado y la agricultura.
La comunidad donde vive se llama “Saqa” ubicado a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Chiclayo. 


Tito se dedica a la compra - venta de abarrotes (bodega), en las instalaciones de su propio domicilio, negocio el cual ha venido administrando muy bien ya que durante los últimos años ha sido el sustento de su familia, pues su negocio lo inicio con muy poco capital de trabajo y su misma dedicación ha llevado a que en la actualidad ya tenga sus clientes conocidos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de la forma de atención que da Tito siendo muy solicitado por los mismo.


Tito aun quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio pues sabe que tiene todavía demanda por satisfacer por lo que desea comprar variedades en mercadería y mas abarrotes para no descuidar las necesidades de su clientes. Y es por ese motivo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para cumplir con dichos objetivos. Pues anhela brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, como a su hijo una mejor educación.

Su bodega de Tito es muy concurrida por lo vecinos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de su persona y así como de su familia.
texts.en:
Tito is 56 years old, married, and lives together with his wife and eldest son in a small district where people mainly farm and raise livestock.  The community is called 'Saqa' and it is located approximately one hour from Chiclayo province.

Tito's business is buying and selling groceries (grocery store).  His store is located in his own home.  He has been running his business very well and in recent years it has provided for his family.  He started his business with very little working capital but, owing to his commitment, he now has a store with regular customers who provide very good references on the service that Tito provides which is very popular with the customers.

Tito would like to continue growing in his business as he knows that he still has demand to satisfy.  He would like to buy a variety of merchandise and more groceries so that he does not neglect his customers' needs. He is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can achieve his goals.  Tito would like to provide his wife with a better quality of life and his son with a better education.

Tito's store is very popular with his neighbors who provide very good references for both Tito and his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries with which to stock his store

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza está conformado por 8 emprendedoras que se ha unido para formar este grupo que son de la misma localidad lo cual este grupo se apoya y se brindan consejos en cada uno de los negocios para salir adelante, es la primera vez que solicitan financiamiento pero todos tiene confianza uno a otros. Jennifer Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad y es parte de este grupo y su actividad a al que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general y con el financiamiento compara ropa, zapatos, sandalias, blusas, cosméticos, entre otros productos que sus solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Nueva Esperanza' (New Hope) community bank has 8 members who came together to form this group as they are all from the same town.  Through their group they support each other and exchange advice about their businesses so that they can make progress.  This is the first time that they have requested a loan but they all trust each other.

Jennifer Fabiola is 21 years old and is a member of this group.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She will use her loan to buy clothing, shoes, sandals, blouses, cosmetics and other products that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, sandals, blouses, cosmetics and other products that her customers are requesting

loans.name: Tabitha Wairimu

texts.en:
Tabitha used her previous loan to buy a dairy cow from which she was able to get enough milk for selling to supply to her various customers. It was very profitable and she was able to pay all the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be her the fifth loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for use on her farm during this planting season. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy spraying chemicals as well as for labor purposes.

In the future, Tabitha hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 2 sons. He describes himself to be a generous man. He operates a mechanic shop where he provides motor vehicle repair. He has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a competitive market and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of spare parts. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. John's  business dream and goal is to run two more mechanic shops within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y las reuniones del banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.  

La socia Eliana sigue dedicando a la venta de ceviche. (Ceviche este es un delicioso plato de bandera frio hecho a  base de pescado y cebollas). La elaboración del ceviche es sencilla y la socia prepara con todos los insumos previamente comprados y frescos. Con el anterior préstamo la socio incremento el capital del negocio y le fue muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Eliana requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes como por ejemplo limón, cebolla y también pagar al proveedor del pescado que le deja. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliana continues as a member of the “IMASUMAC II” community bank whose meetings take place in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province and department.

Eliana continues selling 'ceviche' ('ceviche is a delicious cold dish made from fish and onions).  Making 'ceviche' is simple and Eliana prepares it with fresh ingredients that she buys in advance.  She used her previous loan to increase her working capital and things went very well.

On this occasion, Eliana needs a loan to invest in buying ingredients such as lemons and onions.  She will also pay her fish supplier.

Eliana is grateful for the support that she will receive and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as lemons and onions, and to pay her fish supplier

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria continua con la compra y venta de queso y granos secos. tales como maíz, cebada, trigo, tarwi, frejoles, porotos, habas, y entre otros productos,  leche. La socia desea invertir en la compra de leche en esta ocasion de sus vecinas que tienen vacas lecheras y tambien invertir en la compra de menestras y de granos secos para vender en su stand ambulatorio los fines de semana.
texts.en: Ana Maria continues buying and selling cheese and dried grains such as corn, barley, wheat, tarwi, different types of beans, etc.  On this occasion, she would like to invest in buying milk from her neighbors who have dairy cows, as well as mixed vegetables and dried grains which she will sell on her mobile stand on weekends.

loans.use: to invest in buying milk wholesale and to buy grains to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old, married to Janet, and blessed with eight children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. He is a greenhouse farmer who concentrates on tomatoes and passion fruits. He started his business two years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase a greenhouse tent, dripping irrigation pipe, seeds, support poles and wires for construction. The profit earned will be used to start dairy farming. His dream is to be successful in his business and become financially stable. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase a greenhouse tent, dripping irrigation pipe, seeds, support poles and wires for construction.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. Juliet has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She is also selling vegetables, spices & eggs. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for selling.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia Maria sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq en la provincia del Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Maria sigue dedicando a la venta de joyas de fantasía fina, ella trabaja junto a su conyugue y ambos elaboran las diferentes piezas de aretes, prendedores, anillos, brazaletes, collares, ellos venden sus productos a clientes, compañeros de trabajo, amigos, familiares y a otras personas más. Con el anterior crédito la socia María pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios. En esta oportunidad la socia Maria desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la realización de mayor número de bisutería, ella comprara mercadería como por ejemplo mostacillas de colores, cuarzos, piedrillas, alambres de diferentes materiales, ganchitos y otros.

La socia María agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria continues as a member of the 'IMASUMAC II' community bank which is located in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria continues selling costume jewelry.  She works together with her husband and the couple make different items such as earrings, brooches, rings, bracelets, and necklaces.  They sell their products to customers, work colleagues, friends, family members and other people.  With her previous loan, Maria was able to increase her business capital and she made good profits.  On this occasion, she would like to invest in buying materials so that she can make more jewelry.  She will buy merchandise such as colored beads, quartz, stones, wires of different materials, small hooks, etc.

Maria is grateful for the support that she receives and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny actualemnte continua con sunegocio de compra y venta de carne de cordero, trucha y menudencia de cordero. La socia compra al por mayor cerca de tres corderos a mas depende la temporada y los trozas o vende entero, ella vende desde la carne de primera hasta las menudencias, la socia es una mujer muy conocida en el mercado por lo que tiene buena clientela, ella en esta ocasion desea invertir en la compra de 3 corderos e implementar su negocio con la compra de truchas.
texts.en: Yeny continues in her business buying and selling lamb, lamb offal and trout.  She buys around three lambs, or more depending on the season, wholesale and she either chops them up or sells them whole.  She sells everything from the best-quality meat from the animal to the offal.  She is a very well-known woman in the market and has good customers.  On this occasion, she would like to invest in buying three lambs and also some trout with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to invest in buying three lambs, and to buy trout with which to stock her business

loans.name: Phelesia

texts.en:
Phelesia is 35 years old, married to Peter, and blessed with three children, aged 16, 12 and 8. She sells cabbages, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more cabbages to meet her customers' demands. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying the loan. She hopes to expand her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
