Denis operates a motorcycle transport business which he has been doing for the last three years making a monthly income of KES10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy motorcycle spare parts. 

His profits will be used to repay back the loan. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ruvicha Group

texts.es:
“Ruvicha” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 3° ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades productivas. Todas las integrantes del comité ya cuentan con una actividad empresarial actualmente.
 Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra Bernarda  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comida, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su comida para salir a vender .La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante  y recorre toda la compañía a pie todos los días  y en época escolar tiene su pequeña cantina en la escuela de la mencionada compañía.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para los alimentos que prepara, como ser carne, jamón, queso, panificados, condimentos y demás tipo de productos. Agradece por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
This group is called "Ruvicha" and it now has 12 members and is in its third loan cycle. It is a group of women who are very responsible and hard-working. They work at various productive activities. All the members of the group now have an entrepreneurial activity. We will comment on the case of Señora Bernarda, who has worked for a number of years selling food. She gets up very early to prepare her food so that she can go out to sell it. She sells it as a walking vendor, and she goes through the entire company every day by foot.  During the school year she has a little canteen in the school of the same company.

She is applying for the loan to purchase the ingredients for the food that she prepares, such as meat, ham, cheese, baked products, condiments, and other types of products. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Mark Wendle

texts.en:
Mark Wendle is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Mark Wendle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sell.
Mark Wendle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mark Wendle hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a forty-nine-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who still attend school. Since he’s the main income provider for his family, Bilal is doing the best he can to satisfy their needs. He has run a furniture making shop since 1987. He has his loyal customers and is looking forward to further expanding his business. 

Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase additional materials for his business such as wood, sponges, textiles and many other items. This Kiva loan will increase his productivity thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his business such as wood, sponges, and textiles.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 36-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a pub, a business she started three years ago. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase wine and crates of beer.

The profit she gets will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to see her business expand, and to meet the needs of her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase wine and crates of beer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old married man and the father of four children. Ali is a hardworking man. Fifteen years ago he opened a grocery store in his village to make his living. His family's needs became bigger, and the need for additional income was urgent; that's why he started working as a bus driver, making sure to take almost all the village students from and to the school. Ali is also a builder —  three businesses to cover his family's needs, and still they need more.

Ali is planning to expand and improve his grocery store to keep it suitable for his customers and help increase its income. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary merchandise for his shop, in addition to making small decorations to make a small change to his shop.

Ali is a man with a very good reputation, loved by most of his customers.

He is willing to expand all his businesses to provide his family with the best living conditions.

loans.use: To  buy necessary merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Liliam Johana

texts.es:
La señora Liliam es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace 3 años con la venta de chiverías, además ella comercializa ropa, calzado y productos de belleza…etc.
Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
texts.en:
Señora Liliam is a hard-working woman and an entrepreneur who has a grocery store that she began three years ago with the sale of snacks. In addition, she sells clothing, shoes, beauty products, etc. 

She is married and has two sons, ages 7 and 4, for whom she works hard.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for each of her businesses

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en:
Dexie is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Dexie has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more feeds for her hog-fattening business. 

Dexie has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Dexie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feeds for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Sheba

texts.en:
Sheba is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Sheba has a rice field to harvest and sell rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

Sheba has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sheba hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man living with his three working siblings. He cooperates with his siblings in order to enhance their way of living. 

He has been working in one of the local companies for 12 years. At the same time, he hopes to help his nephew with his education. For that reason, he has big and serious responsibilities to take care of. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his nephew's educational fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to see him graduating and achieving his master’s degree. In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering his study fees.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's educational fees until graduation.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Marlyn has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2001. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Medalla Milagrosa es el grupo integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ellas son activas, trabajadoras y se dedican a variadas actividades, gracias a las cuales pueden ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que necesitan a sus familiares.
Una historia muy conmovedora es el de la señora Maria que es una señora humilde  de muy escasos recursos económicos, no sabe leer ni escribir y nunca tuvo una propuesta ni oportunidad de crédito y con este programa obtuvo la ayuda que tanto buscaba para poder trabajar. Ella es artesana y se dedica al bordado de todo tipo de productos, con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Está por más agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido, ya que nadie ha apostado por ella antes.
texts.en:
Medalla Milagrosa is a group of 12 women in the city of Carapeguá.  They are active, hardworking, and engaged in various activities.  Thanks to those activities they are able to help their families and provide them with what they need.

A very moving story is that of Maria, who is a humble woman with very scarce financial resources.  She does not know how to read or write and had never had a proposal nor a loan opportunity.  With this program she received that help that she was looking for in order to be able to work.  She is an artisan and does embroidery on all types of products, therefore helping out her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase needles and thread, which she will use to continue working and helping her family.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received, as nobody had taken a chance on her before.

loans.use: to purchase needles and thread.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children. 
Alan is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.
Alan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Alan hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Lawahez

texts.en:
Lawahez is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children, who are all studying. She cooperates with her husband, who is the main source of income in the family and has big responsibilities to care for. He has been working in a local company since 1997. 

As for her, she has been selling fruits and vegetables all over the villages. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to open a cafe just next to her vegetable shop. She notes that this will increase her sales by 20 percent. In the future, she plans to enhance her work and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to open a cafe just next to her vegetable shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children.
 
Samuel has a rice field to harvest and sell rice grains during harvest time. He has had this business for 35 years. He requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

Samuel became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Samuel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has worked for five years as a school bus driver. He owns a small van that helps him in making his living; it is his only source of living, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to change his van's engine to keep it in good shape.

Mohamad is a hardworking man, trusted by most of his customers. This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that his future loans will help him to buy a new bus that will please and comfort his customers. 
   
He also hopes to open a transportation company in the future.

loans.use: To change his van's engine.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
1.	El comité denominado Las Marías, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 1º ciclo con 11 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en salir adelante en invertir el crédito en sus respectivas actividades. Son muy activas, y tienen la intención de lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad con el objetivo de iniciar un negocio propio.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles en forma ambulante, actividad que le demanda mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio físico pero ella lo realiza con mucha alegría porque sabe que con ello obtendrá los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida  y también de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, condimentos, aderezos y demás insumos necesarios para los alimentos que prepara. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
1. This group, called "Las Marias," is from the city of Carapeguá. It is now in its first loan cycle and has 11 members. They are hard-working women who are doing their best to advance by investing their loans in their respective activities. They are very active and intend to succeed in improving their entrepreneurship; others, nevertheless, are starting with their first activity with the goal of beginning their own business.

Señora Maria sells food as a walking vendor, an activity that demands much effort and physical sacrifice from her, but she does it with great happiness because she knows that with it she will obtain the income necessary to improve her quality of life, and also because in this way she will be able to help her family members.

She is applying for the loan to purchase meat, baked goods, condiments, seasonings, and other ingredients necessary for the food that she prepares. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity to progress that they give them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Patricia originaria del sauce,  es madre de tres hijos los cuales todos son edad escolar. 
Ella al igual que su esposo son personas trabajadoras y luchadoras, que tienen como fin mejorar cada día su casa para brindarles un bienestar feliz a sus hijos así como llevarles el pan de cada día.

Se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria en una escuela de la localidad donde tiene pocos años de dedicarse a este oficio el cual  le ha servido para contar con sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de mejorar la cocina de su vivienda por lo que solicita su primer crédito en Ceprodel, para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra, lo que espera que dicha Institución le brinde su mano y  apoye para cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia is a native of Sauce.  She is mother to three school-aged children.  She and her husband are hard workers and fighters, whose goal is to make improvements to their home day by day to provide happiness and wellbeing to their children, as well as provide for them.  

Carla Patricia is a primary school teacher at the local school.  She has been doing this for a few years.   It has provided her with her own income and enabled her to help her husband with household expenses.  

She needs to improve the kitchen in her home so she is requesting her first loan with Ceprodel.  She will purchase bricks and cement, and pay for labor.  She hopes that Ceprodel will provide her with support to meet her objective.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Eterio

texts.es:
El señor Eterio tiene 49 años de edad vive con esposa y su hijo de 14 años de edad quienes le ayudan en el negocio.
Eterio se dedica a la venta de materiales de Construcción. El señor empezó con su actividad junto con su señora hace aproximadamente 5 años. Nos cuenta que empezó con el negocio gracias a una herencia que el padre le había dejado, y gracias al trabajo arduo y a la buena atención pudo ir aumentando de poco su negocio, por lo que actualmente cuenta con clientela formada, que siempre acude hasta su negocio.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cementos, piedras y demás materiales con lo cual podrá surtir su local y de esa forma tener bien abastecido su negocio.
texts.en:
Eterio is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 14-year old son, both of whom help with his business.  

Eterio sells construction supplies.  He began this business along with his wife about 5 years ago.  He started the business thanks to an inheritance that his father left him.  Thanks to hard work and good service he has been able to grow the business bit by bit, and he now has a regular clientele who always come to his business.  

He is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, stones, and other materials to stock his store and ensure his business is well provisioned.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Activas” ya que todas están en busca de sus progresos y mejor condición de vida. El comité se encuentra en el Cuarto Ciclo con 20 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Gladis es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de joyas y de prendas de todo tipo. Ella comenta que vende sus productos a todos sus vecinos y también a otros clientes que gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado tener. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women), because each member of the group is seeking to make progress and improve their standard of living.  This bank is in its 4th loan cycle, and has 20 members.  Each member has their own business activity, and they are a very united and responsible group in which the members support each other. 

Gladis is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who has a business selling all kinds of garments and jewelry.  She comments that she sells her products to all of her neighbors, and also to other customers whom she managed to attract due to the good quality of her products.  Her wish is to continue to grow her business so that she can have a better income.

She is requesting this loan to buy all types of jewelry, so that she can meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Luchadoras”, está integrado  por  21  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas del barrio, que se ha unido con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Petrona es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella siempre tiene mucha variedad, y es por ello que ha logrado formarse una buena clientela. Ella empezó con unos pocos clientes, pero hoy en día ya es una buena microempresaria que desea seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, con lo cual podrá seguir abasteciendo su negocio y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Striving Women). It is formed by 21 very active and united women from the same zone. All of them are friends and neighbors from the neighborhood, who have joined together with the will to succeed and help each other. Now they are in their sixth loan cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women program at the foundation.

Petrona is one of the members of the group. She sells clothing. She always has a great variety, and for that reason she has succeeded in forming a good customer base. She began with a few customers, but now she is already a good microbusinesswoman who wants to continue growing. She is applying for the loan to buy clothing, with which she will be able to continue stocking her business and filling the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ramielyn

texts.en:
Ramielyn is married and has 5 children. She is 45 years old, and resides at Capucao, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For the past 5 years she has owned and operated a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. 

Ramielyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Genebeve

texts.en:
Genebeve is married with 2 children. She is 24 years old, and lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For the past 2 years she has been planting, harvesting and selling corn for a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. 

Genebeve has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married and has 7 children. She is 45 years old, and resides at Capucao, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For the past 5 years she has been planting, harvesting and selling corn for a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. 

Fe has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete”, está constituido  por 23  señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas que quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Tienen  como objetivo el crecimiento de todas ellas tanto en lo económico como en lo personal.
Maris, es una de las miembros del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante e ir creciendo. Su meta es poder seguir ayudando a su familia y a la vez seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
Maris acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de prendas de variada calidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" and is composed of 23 very active and supportive women. They are all friends and neighbors and want to progress and help their children and relatives. Their common goal is growth, both economical and personal.

Maris is one of the group members. She says that she sells various kinds of garments. She began with a small store, which thanks to her effort and sacrifice managed to succeed and grow. Her goal is to continue helping her family and at the same time growing her small business.

Maris turned to the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for financial support to buy garments of various qualities, which she will stock in her store in order to have a larger product range to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for later resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has one child. She is 23 years old, and resides at Capucao, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For the past 5 years, she has owned and operated a business venture planting & harvesting bananas and coconuts for sale. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. 

Juliet has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This year, she joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She is 35 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, she operates a business which produces bananas and coconuts for sale. She has been in this farming business for  2 years, and earns PHP 2,500 monthly. 

Romelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This year, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 22 year old lady from Kisumu and is married to Benjamin. They have six children, five are her step children.

Everlyne operates a grocery store selling various foodstuffs, a business she has been doing for the last 2 years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy kale, oranges, mangoes and carrots. Her profits will be used to add a stock of vegetables and oranges to her store.

Her dream is to have a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy kale, oranges, mangoes and carrots.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s working non-stop to be able to satisfy his family's demands. He has 22 years of experience as a painter and works independently upon requests. In parallel, he has also been working in floor cleaning. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added painting tools and a floor cleaning machine for his business. He notes that this will improve his business and allow him to take on more projects. In the future, he plans to take bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase added painting tools and a floor cleaning machine for his business.

loans.name: Temotea

texts.en:
Temotea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Temotea has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. Temotea has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Temotea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Lumenada

texts.en:
Lumenada is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lumenada has a shop to buy and sell rattan and also to make and sell sweeping brooms. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of rattan and materials needed for making brooms.

Lumenada has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lumenada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rattan and materials needed for making brooms.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents. All the family combines forces in order to cover their heavy costs of life. 

Ahmad opened his own bakery in 1998. He has a wide range of food and products, and is looking to further enlarge his bakery. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new baking tools and supplies for his business. He notes that this will improve his work, which will allow him to attract more clients. In the future, he plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase new baking tools and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Carla Patricia tiene 38 años de edad, ella trabaja como maestra de primaria en uno de los colegios de la comunidad donde habita. Carla Patricia tiene dos hijos que todavía están a su cargo y están estudiando. Carla Patricia posee una propiedad donde desde hace  tiempo le quiere realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda lo cual está solicitando financiamiento para realizarlas con el crédito comprara bloques, zinc, cemento, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Carla Patricia is 38 and works as a primary school teacher in a local community school. Carla Patricia has two children that she cares for and who are students. Carla Patricia has owned a property for some time which she wishes to fix up; for this reason she now seeks credit to buy cement blocks, zinc, cement, sand and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, zinc, cement, sand and other construction materials.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia Doris sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Doris sigue dedicando a la elaboración y a la venta de jugos en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Con el anterior préstamo pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios como por ejemplo dar mejor alimentación a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo frutas y azúcar para seguir preparando más jugos. 

La socia Doris agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Doris is a member of the communal lender “IMASUMAC II”, and lives and works in Cusco.  Doris makes and sells juices in one of the most popular city markets of Cusco.  With a former loan she was able to increase her working capital and was able to better provide for her children.  With this credit she wants to buy items such as fruit and sugar in order to prepare more juices.  Doris is very grateful for the support offered and is committed to disciplined repayment of the funds.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials to equip her juice business

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Fidela has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Fidela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fidela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Los Gavilanes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Gavilanes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ángela Rosa quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años negocio que inicio con la venta de chiverías y luego fue comprando otros productos. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de granos básicos.
Los otros integrantes son Francisco Agustín quien elabora cepillos para lavar ropa y Eveling quien tiene un pequeña venta y produce cepillos para lavar.
texts.en: The Los Gavilanes  group is comprised of 3 hardworking and entrepreneurial people.  One member is Ángela Rosa who has had a grocery store for 10 years.  She started the business selling dairy products and later began buying other products.  She will use the loan to purchase basic grains.  The other members are Francisco Agustín who makes brushes to wash clothes and Eveling who has a small shop and makes brushes for cleaning.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains.

loans.name: Las Mias Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las mías lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosmery quien se dedica al comercio esquimo y cervezas en su casa de habitación. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de productos esquimo y  licor.  
Las otras integrantes son María Lourdes quien vende refrescos, hamburguesas y hot-dog y Sonia Fernanda se dedica al comercio de cosméticos.
texts.en: The Las Mías group is comprised of three hardworking and entrepreneurial people.  One member is Rosmery ,who has a business selling ice cream and beer from a room in her home.  She will use the loan to purchase ice cream and liquor.  Other members of the group are María Lourdes, who sells soft drinks, hamburgers, and hot dogs, and Sonia Fernanda, who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and liquor.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Los Altos De Mostatepe Group

texts.es:
El grupo los altos de mostatepe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana quien vende mercadería en general desde zapatos, sabanas, ropa usada…etc. Este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años y con crédito ella piensa reforzarlo con la compra de mercadería. 
Las otras integrantes son Ebarista quien vende comida y mercadería en general y Elizabeth tiene una pulpería y verdulería desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
This group is called "Altos de Mostatepe" and includes 3 hard-working people, one of whom is Juana who sells varied general merchandise such as shoes, sheets, used clothing, etc.  She has managed this business for 5 years and with this loan hopes to invest in buying more merchandise to sell. 
Ebarista is another member, who sells food and general merchandise, and Elizabeth who has run a small store, selling vegetables for the past 4 years.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, sheets, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manantial El Desierto Group

texts.es:
El grupo Manantial en el Desierto lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras la coordinadora es María Auxiliadora quien vende en su casa aluminio y ropa desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo invertirá en reforzar el negocio con la compra de mercadería y su meta es mejorar su casa la cual poco a poco ha logrado con las ganancias obtenidas con el crédito anterior logro embaldosar su casa y comprarse una lavadora.
Ella es casada y tiene a su cargo a su hijo menor de 11 años.
Las otras integrantes son Fátima quien vende cobertores, cubiertas para sofá y junto a su esposo tiene un microbús donde realiza recorridos a niños y Lucia del Carmen se dedica al destace de cerdo.
texts.en: The group Manantial en el Desierto has three working members.  María Auxiliadora is the coordinator, and has sold aluminum and clothing from her home for the past 8 years.  She seeks this credit to increase her merchandise for sale and her goal is to little by little improve her home; with a prior loan she was able to buy a washer.  She is married and cares for one child, aged 11.  Another member is Fatima, who sells sofa covers and with her husband has a small bus to transport children.  The third member is Lucia del Carmen who raises pigs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food stocks.

loans.name: Por La Gracia De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo por la Gracia de Dios lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Mercedes se dedica a la venta de chiverías y granos básicos desde hace 6 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.
Las otras integrantes son Yadira quien tiene una venta desde hace 4 años y Mariana quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
texts.en: The Gracia de Dios group has three hard-working members.  One of them is María Mercedes who for the past 6 years has sold items such as basic grains and now seeks this credit to buy a variety of products in quantity.  Other members include Yadira who has worked in sales for 4 years and Mariana who has a small restaurant, selling fried foods.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products in quantity, especially basic grains

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 23 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor que esta en edad escolar, la casa en la que vive es propia y vive junto a su esposo, vive en un caserío rural del distrito de Lambayeque de nombre “Virgen de la Purísima Concepción”, su caserío es uno de los pocos que cuentan con los servicio de básicos de agua y energía eléctrica, es pequeña y cuenta aproximadamente con unas 50 familias.

Su actividad económica de Magdalena es el dedicarse durante todos los días al cuidado de sus animales (ovinos, porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral) los cuales al obtener el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en distintos mercados del distrito de Lambayeque, pues de esa manera se ha generado los ingresos para el sustento de su familia durante 5 años, negocio el cual desea incrementar debido a que hay bastante demanda por satisfacer.

Pues en su deseo de seguir cumpliendo con sus objetivos Magdalena esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales utilizará para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento de sus animales, y el mismo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Magdalena is married with one young, school-age child.  She lives in her own home with her husband in a rural village in the district of Lambayeque called Virgen de la Purísima Concepción.  Her village is one of the few that have basic utilities such as water and electricity.  It is small and has around 50 families.

For a living, Magdalena takes care of her animals every day (sheep, pigs, goats, and fowl).  When they reach their ideal size and weight, she sells them in different markets in the district of Lambayeque.  This is how she has generated the income to support her family for five years and she wants to expand her business because there is a good amount of demand to satisfy.

In her desire to keep achieving her goals, Magdalena is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1,000 nuevos soles.  She will use this money to buy feed so her animals will fatten better and grow faster, which will allow her to achieve her goal of giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Marites has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has thirteen children. 

Bebiana has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for eleven years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Bebiana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a 36-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where, with her husband as the driver, she has been providing motorela or motorcycle services for 10 years.

A member of HSPFI since 2011, Evelyn is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline required for the services provided. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, a 58-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverage for 15 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Teresa sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Teresa sigue dedicando a la elaboración panes osea sigue teniendo la pequeña panadería en su domicilio.  Con el anterior préstamo pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios como por ejemplo pudo dar mejor educación a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y otras cosas más. 

La socia Teresa agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is still a member of the Imasumac II Communal Bank. She lives and works in the city of Cusco.

Teresa makes bread and sells it from a bakery in her home. With the previous loan she invested in her business and because of improved earnings, she was able to provide a better education for her children. This time she is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast etc.

Teresa is grateful for the assistance and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, a 31-year-old married mother of two children aged 11 and 6 years, has been selling maize for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. Now requesting her first loan, she will repay it out of profits from her enterprise. Grace dreams of bettering her future and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 27 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Airene has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Airene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Airene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Rosela has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosela has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rosela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 56-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and only child who is still attending college. Khalil is the one responsible for paying his family's expenses and supporting them. He has owned a clothing shop since 2009, and he’s well known for his fashionable and stylish clothes. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the new spring collection of clothes in order to increase his sales and therefore his profits. In the future, he plans to open a new kid’s section.

loans.use: to purchase the new spring collection of clothes.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia Gregoria sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde sigue realizando diferentes actividades económicas. 

La socia Gregoria sigue administrando su propio negocio. Desde hace 21 años que se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y comida típicas de la región, ella sigue con la pequeña picantería donde expende sus productos.  Con el anterior préstamo Gregoria pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios como por ejemplo dar mejor educación a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo jora, comestibles, carnes rojas, verduras  y otras cosas más. 

La socia Gregoria agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Gregoria still belongs to the Imasumac II communal bank.  She continues to live in the city of Cusco, and that is where she continues engaging in her different business activities.

Gregoria still runs her own business.  For 21 years she has been selling “chicha de jora” (corn based drink) and typical regional food.  She still has her small snack shop where she sells her products.  

With her previous loan Gregoria was able to increase her business capital, and she received good benefits like giving her children a better education.

At this time she needs a loan to buy supplies like corn, foodstuffs, red meat, and vegetables, among others.

Gregoria is grateful for the support she will be granted, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 24 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jennifer is a pharmacy attendant in a drug store .  She has also a retail store and her husband is the one who manages it.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 in order to buy stock for the retail store.

Jennifer has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for the retail store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 9,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and seven children. Two of his children are working and the others are still studying.  They are all cooperating together to be able to enrich their way of living. 

In 2005, Imad decided to open his own silver items and home accessories shop. He sells original products at fair prices, which makes his customers loyal to him. Today he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to buy added silver items and home accessories for his shop. He is sure that buying these new items will help him earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open a home accessories shop.

loans.use: to buy added silver items and home accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 46-year-old married man and the father of six children.

Haidar is a hardworking man and, for the last 30 years, he has worked as a photographer.

In 1980, Haidar opened his shop.  He enjoys wedding photography, he is really talented in his field and recommended by most of his clients.

Haidar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new album collection, in addition to necessary photography tools and raw materials.

This is Haidar's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, his previous loan had an an impressive effect on his social and financial situation.

Haidar hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy a new album collection, in addition to necessary photography tools and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – из Павлограда. Она работает на центральном рынке города и торгует там канцтоварами. Торговая точка находится в проходном ряду, что явно способствует высоким уровням продаж. Ольга занимается этим бизнесом уже более 5 лет. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 6 500 гривен в месяц. 

Недавно соседи-предприниматели решили продать свой торговый павильон. Ольга сразу же увидела в этом возможность расширения для себя и купила у них соседнее место, увеличив свои обороты и расширив свой бизнес. Сейчас Ольга обратилась за кредитом в КИВА для того, чтобы закупить канцтовары для новой точки продаж. Она хочет и в дальнейшем продолжать расширять свой бизнес, вкладывая в него полученные средства и развиваясь в качестве малого предпринимателя. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Olga is from Pavlograd.  She works in the city's central market where she sells office supplies.  Her shop is located on a central aisle, which clearly contributes to her high levels of sales.  Olga has already been in this business for more than 5 years.  Her monthly income is around 6,500 hryven.  

Not long ago, the neighboring shopkeepers decided to sell their shop.  Olga immediately saw this as an opportunity to expand her own business and bought it.  In so doing she has increased her inventory and expanded her business.  Now, Olga is seeking a loan through Kiva in order to buy up office supplies for the inventory in her new sales outlet.  She wants to continue to expand her business in the future by reinvesting her profits and by her own development as a small businessperson.

Note:  story in Russian

loans.use: to buy office supplies for her new sales outlet

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 42, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she has been operating a sausage-selling business for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband has a business buying cattle to resell at a profit and earns about USD 5 per day.

In order to improve her husband's business, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her husband’s purchase of more cattle to resell in order to increase profits to better support the family.

In the future, Touch would like to use the extra profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor degrees. As well, she plans to rebuild their present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide a better living situation for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital for her husband's purchase of more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a farmer and a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya where he has made farming his main business and source of livelihood for supporting his two children, aged seven and five years. His farm produces milk for the local market.

Wesley has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy two dairy cows. He says this is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He used the first loan of 50,000 KES to buy his first dairy cow. He adds that his focus is to have enough dairy cows to earn a better income that will enable him to venture into the transportation business of motorcycles, and later motor vehicles.

He says that the high costs of inputs remains the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis es un joven que se dedica al transporte público durante 8 horas al día, tiempo en el que puede obtener una ganancia de hasta S/.35, el está muy contento por la labor que realiza ya que mediante esta puede permitirse tener una buena calidad de vida y está completamente seguro que con el transcurso del tiempo podrá realizar muchas mejoras y progresar constantemente.

Jose Luis es consciente de que su negocio tiene éxito por la buena atención que le brinda a sus clientes y la capacidad que tiene de transportarlos con seguridad. Actualmente él tiene algunas reparaciones por realizar a su moto taxi, es por eso que desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo y de esa manera realice el reforzamiento de su moto y prepararse para la temporada de invierno.

Con mucho esfuerzo y mucha más dedicación, Jose Luis podrá generar los ingresos necesarios para construir su casa propia y algún día poder comprarse otra moto taxi.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is a young man who works in public transportation 8 hours a day, during which time he can make a profit of S/.35. He is very happy with the work that he does as it has enabled him to have a good quality of life and he is completely sure that, over time, he will be able to make many improvements and constantly progress.
Jose Luis is conscious that his business is successful because of the attention that he pays to his customers and his capacity to transport them safely. He currently needs to make some repairs to his moto taxi, and this is why he hopes that the Kiva lenders can help him to fix his vehicle and prepare it for the winter season. 
With a lot of efforts and even more dedication, Jose Luis will be able to generate the income he needs to build his own house and someday to be able to buy another moto taxi.

loans.use: to reinforce his moto taxi

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children.

Azucena has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 13,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Rolando Agustin

texts.es:
Rolando es un señor de 60 años, el está muy decidió a salir adelante y esta segurísimo que la edad no es impedimento para demostrarse a si mismo que puede hacer grandes cosas, él se dedica a hacer deporte todos los momentos en los que puede. A Rolando le hubiese gustado poder ser Ingeniero Civil pero por diversas circunstancias no pudo lograrlo, aún así no se detuvo y eso lo fortaleció mucho más para salir adelante y demostrarse a sí mismo que puede lograrlo.

Con muchas ganas, Rolando sale todos los días a las 7:30 de la mañana y trabaja hasta las 10 de la noche, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 55 clientes diarios, él está muy contento con los resultados que está obteniendo y está deseoso continuar saliendo adelante. Su hijo lo ánimo para que se dedicará a esta actividad y es así como Rolando accedió.

En estos momentos, este hombre tan trabajador necesita la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, para que de esa manera pueda realizar algunos reforzamientos a su mototaxi lo que le permitirá trabajar mucho más tranquilo y con el mejor rendimiento de la moto podrá obtener los ingresos que necesita para construir su casa a base de material noble.
texts.en:
Rolando is a 60 year old man. He is very determined to succeed and he is certain that age is no barrier to proving to himself that he can do big things. He plays sports any time that he can. Rolando would have liked to be a civil engineer but various circumstances prevented him from achieving this. Even so, this didn't hold him back and it gave him strength to succeed and show himself what he could do. 
Rolando happily goes out to work every day at 7:30 in the morning and works until 10 at night, during which time he serves an average of 55 customers a day. He is very happy with the results that he has achieved and is anxious to keep moving forward. His son motivates him to do this work.
At the moment, this very hardworking man needs the help of the Kiva lenders to make some repairs to his moto taxi which will permit him to work much more easily and, with the improved performance of his vehicle, he will be able to make better profits that he needs to build his house.

loans.use: to fix his moto taxi.

loans.name: Rosa Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una mujer iqueña que lucha por sacar adelante a sus 3 pequeños hijos, su esposo es también un gran apoyo para ella, debido a que como él trabaja como chofer de taxi sus ingresos les permiten compartir los gastos y desde luego poder de esa manera ofrecerse una mejor calidad de vida día a día.

Anteriormente Rosa no generaba mucho ingresos es por esto que no tuvo mejor idea que dedicarse a la confección y así poder comprar algunos otros, de esa manera pudo comprar todos los vestidos que creía necesario para iniciar su negocio, hasta el momento todo marcha bien y en sus 8 horas laborables atiende a un promedio de 5 clientes, los mismos que desean asistir a fiesta de graduación, matrimonios, bautizos, entre otros.

Rosa constantemente tiene la intención de progresar y mejorar, es por esta razón que también tiene una bodega en su casa, lugar en donde puede generar ingresos extras. Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Rosa podrá comprar nuevos y mejores vestidos para alquilar debido a que ahora se renovó la temporada. Su gran sueño es poder tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad y así tener un negocio próspero que le permita cuidar y educar muy bien a sus tres hijos, a los cuales ama mucho.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman from Ica who struggles to get her three young children ahead.  Her husband is a great support to her because he works as a taxi driver.  His income allows them to share the expenses and to later be able to have a better quality of daily life.

Previously, Rosa did not generate much income.  That is why she could come up with no better idea than to make clothes and then be able to buy some others.  This is how she was able to buy all of the dresses that she needed to start her business.  So far everything is going well.  In the eight hours that she works she takes care of an average of five customers.  They want to attend a graduation party, weddings, and baptisms, among others.

Rosa’s continual intention is to make progress and to improve.  That is why she also has a grocery store in her house.  It is a place where she can generate extra income.

With the help of the Kiva lenders Rosa will be able to buy new and better dresses to rent.  The season is now starting again.  Her big dream is to be able to have her own place in the center of the city.  That way she would have a prosperous business that would allow her to take care of her three children.  She would be able to give her children, whom she loves very much, a good education.

loans.use: to buy new dresses.

loans.name: Leonso Ramon

texts.es: Leonso Ramón tiene 40 años de edad, trabaja como coordinador de guarda de seguridad en una de las empresas de la localidad, ya tiene años de estar trabajando en esta área de guarda de seguridad. Leonso tiene dos hijos en el cual está todavía a su cargo y están estudiando. Este emprendedor esta solicitando financiamiento para realizarle las mejoras de su vivienda lo cual con el financiamiento comprara zinc, piedrín, tubos, cementos entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Leonso Ramón is 40, and works as a security guard coordinator in one of the local companies. He has been working in the security field for years.  Leonso has two children he is still responsible for, and they go to school. This entrepreneur is applying for a loan to carry out improvements to his home. 

He will use the loan to buy sheet metal, gravel, pipes, cement and other construction materials.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal, gravel, pipes, cement and other construction materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia tiene 27años, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella se dedica al comercio, en el cual trabajo desde el 2006. Ella se dedica a la venta de articulos de primera necesidad, como ser harina azucar, como asi tambien la venta de prendas de vestir.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que ha trabajado desde siempre, y es por ello que no teme a ningun trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo, y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azucar, harina, bebidas y demás insumos de primera necesidad, los cuales son los que más salida tienen. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la oportunidad que le está dando.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is 27 years old and lives in the city of Curuguaty. She has been running her business since 2006, a store in which she sells staple food such as flour and sugar, and also clothes. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has worked all her life; that's the reason why she isn't afraid of any kind of work. Her goal is to keep on growing and thus helping her family.

She applies for this loan to buy sugar, flour, drinks and other products of daily use, which have the highest turnover. She thanks the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the provided opportunity.

loans.use: to buy staple food for her grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his tricycle-truck so he can haul and sell recycled materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Las señora Victoria se dedica a la venta de cereales tostados como maíz y también arroz cuenta con vivienda propia ubicada en la zona de valle hermoso zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, vive con su ultima hija y su madre,  su esposo por cuestiones de trabajo esta fuera de la ciudad en una  mina en la ciudad de Oruro, la señora vende tostados mas conocidos como pasankalla, hecho de maíz, la señora compra y vende ambulando en carretilla, ya que este producto es accesible al bolsillo es bastante demandado en el mercado, y la señora ambula por mercados céntricos de la ciudad, y tiene que vender diariamente por que su propósito es terminar de construir su casa para mejorar su estilo de vida, por este motivo solicita en crédito para la compra de material de construcción, para hacer construir un cuarto, y así brindar mayor  comodidad a su familia, se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Victoria has a business selling toasted cereals such as corn and also rice.  She has her own home, which is located in the Valle Hermoso neighborhood in the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba.  She lives with her youngest daughter and her mother.  Her husband is away from the city for work reasons; he works in a mine in the city of Oruro.  Victoria sells some well-known cereal snacks such as pasankalla (sweet roasted corn), made from corn.  She buys and sells from a cart on the street.  Because this product is affordable, there is a lot of demand for it in the market.  Victoria goes around the markets in the center of the city, and she has to sell daily because her goal is to finish construction on her house so that she can improve her living conditions.  This is the reason that she is requesting a loan, so that she can buy construction materials to build a room.  In this way, she will provide better comfort to her family.  She feels happy to have this opportunity so that she can continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to add a room to her house

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Eva has pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.

Jovy has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and jeans to sell

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Se, 66, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying junk materials to resell at the junk shop for over six years, earning approximately USD $2 per day. Her husband runs the business of repairing bicycles and earns about USD $3 per day. Her two children are employed - one is a garment worker and the other one is employed in a pottery factory. They earn approximately USD $8 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Se is requesting for a loan of USD $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This purchase would enable her children to use the saved money on transportation expenses to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Rosalyn has pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Zainab. She is married to a driver and has 2 children aged 6 years and 8 months old. She has no additional dependents.  

In 2001, Zainab established her Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavour of soups and stews), rood season, and cooking oil business. She began her business because her husband, who was supporting the home strongly, was relieved of his job. She was so dependent on him for survival as she didn't learn a trade, so as a result, she went to her elder brother who advised her to go in to business. Her brother gave her some capital to start the business so that she can also be supportive of her husband. Since then, she worked hard to improve on her capital up to this time. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Zainab requested for a loan in order to buy cooking oil and Maggi. In the future, Zainab plans to rent a big shop after making big capital so that she fully support her husband in taking care of the home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and Maggi

loans.name: Lout

texts.en: Lout, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three school-aged children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs the business of producing incense sticks to sell and earns about USD 17 per day. In order to develop her husband’s business, Lout is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in the business for purchasing more raw materials to produce more incense sticks to sell. By doing so, her family income will be increased. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand the business and help her children get bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger in order to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce more incense sticks to sell
